meanings.sent1: The toothpaste will extrude from the tube when you squeeze it.
meanings.sent2: The machine can extrude plastic into various shapes.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally extruded too much ketchup on my hotdog!
meanings.sent4: Her anger seemed to extrude from every pore of her body.
meanings.sent5: The volcano began to extrude lava, creating a fiery spectacle.

meanings.definition: To shape or form by forcing through a die
meanings.sent1: The playdough can extrude through the mold to make different shapes.
meanings.sent2: The factory uses a machine to extrude metal into specific designs.
meanings.sent3: He tried to extrude the cookie dough into a heart shape, but it ended up looking like a blob.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to extrude a sense of warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands skillfully extrude clay into intricate sculptures.
